alert.note: Alert for Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Midland (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 8:47PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Glasscock, northeastern Midland, southwestern Howard and southern Martin Counties through 930 PM CDT... At 847 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Stanton, or 8 miles north of Greenwood, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Midland, Stanton, Lomax, Courtney and Stanton Municipal Aiport. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 146 and 167. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for western Texas.
